skill.author: hylarucoder

security_audit.summary: This skill is a documentation review tool that analyzes markdown files and generates consistency reports. All static analysis findings were false positives - the 'external commands' were markdown code blocks showing example syntax, not actual code execution. The skill performs read-only operations on documentation files.

content.value_statement: Documentation often becomes outdated as code evolves, leading to developer confusion and wasted time. This skill systematically compares your README, API docs, and configuration guides against actual implementation to identify inconsistencies.
actual_capabilities: Compares README features against actual code implementation
Validates API documentation matches OpenAPI/proto schemas
Checks environment variables listed in docs vs code
Generates detailed inconsistency reports with severity levels
limitations: Requires existing documentation to compare against code
Cannot detect missing documentation for new features
May need manual verification for complex business logic
Performance depends on codebase size and documentation volume

use_cases.title: Pre-release Documentation Audit
use_cases.description: Before shipping v2.0, verify all README examples, API docs, and setup guides match the actual implementation to prevent user confusion.

use_cases.title: API Documentation Validation
use_cases.description: Ensure your OpenAPI spec, endpoint documentation, and code implementation are perfectly aligned after refactoring endpoints.

use_cases.title: Security Documentation Review
use_cases.description: Verify that security configurations like CORS, CSP, authentication methods in documentation match actual security implementations.

prompt_templates.title: Basic README Review
prompt_templates.scenario: Check if README matches current code
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my README.md for consistency with the actual code implementation. Focus on features, setup instructions, and API examples.

prompt_templates.title: API Documentation Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare our API documentation in docs/api.md with the actual endpoint implementations. Check request/response formats, status codes, and error handling.

prompt_templates.title: Configuration Guide Check
prompt_templates.scenario: Verify env vars and config docs
prompt_templates.prompt: Review docs/configuration.md against our actual configuration files. Verify environment variables, default values, and setup requirements are accurate.

prompt_templates.title: Full Documentation Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a comprehensive documentation consistency review across README.md, docs/**/*.md, and compare with code implementation. Generate a detailed report with severity levels and fix recommendations.

output_examples.input: Check if my README setup instructions are still accurate
output: - **Issue**: README shows 'npm run db:init' but actual script is 'npm run db:create'
- **Impact**: New developers cannot set up the project following README
- **Fix**: Update README to use 'npm run db:create'

best_practices: Run documentation reviews after major code changes or before releases
Focus on P0 and P1 issues first as they block or significantly impact users
Use the parallel agent approach for large codebases to speed up reviews
anti_patterns: Don't rely solely on this skill for security audits - combine with security-specific tools
Avoid running on generated documentation without verifying the source templates
Don't ignore P2/P3 issues long-term as they accumulate and confuse users

faq.question: What types of documentation can this skill review?
faq.answer: It reviews README.md, docs/**/*.md files, and compares them against code implementation, OpenAPI specs, and configuration files.

faq.question: How does it determine severity levels?
faq.answer: P0 = Security/blocking issues, P1 = Core functionality broken, P2 = Minor inconsistencies, P3 = Cosmetic issues.

faq.question: Can it review non-English documentation?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill supports multilingual documentation and has been tested with Chinese and English content.

faq.question: How long does a typical review take?
faq.answer: For small projects (under 50 files), 2-3 minutes. Large projects may take 10-15 minutes or can use parallel agents.

faq.question: Does it modify my documentation?
faq.answer: No, it only generates review reports. You decide which recommendations to implement.

faq.question: Can it detect missing documentation?
faq.answer: It identifies documented features that don't exist in code, but won't find undocumented features. Focus is on consistency.
